website_summaries.verdict: Great price point for a substantial racquet, which even includes a cover.
pros: Lightweight (140 grams) with a well-balanced feel, this racquet has the largest head size allowed for maximum hitting
Good for precision hitting into the corners, and no noticeable vibrations either
cons: The racquet has a stiff feel, so it can be hard on the wrists

customer_reviews.title: Great racket, sweet price.
customer_reviews.text: Big sweet spot. East swing. Good head control. At a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey R.. Weissman

customer_reviews.title: Quick and Well Balanced
customer_reviews.text: I used it as an interim racquet till I got my regular one strung again. It’s very well balanced and hits very well. Good power when u get that sweet spot. Passed it to my little 8 year old who finds it quick through the air. Great racquet BK, thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Kapil Mehta

customer_reviews.title: Not so durable, this is my second racket
customer_reviews.text: Very durable, this is my second racket, I still have my bandit 2 running without any problem from last 4 years, I have bought this after seeing the durability and control of my first one, it is not very heavy and gives power when required. ------An update on the review----------- Bandit 2 was better, this racket broke after playing 2 weeks! Big disappointment, I did not even hit it a wall!
customer_reviews.author: Sony Sebastian

customer_reviews.title: Good quality to price for occasional player, no bad surprise
customer_reviews.text: I play squash once a week, and I have been using this racquet for 3 years now. As a disclaimer, I am not a squash expert, but the players I have played with who know more about this than I do seem to say that the racquet is pretty good, and if you are an occasional player, it seems that you get a pretty good racquet for the price. As a con, I have broken the racquet once every year, so had to buy a new one. Either I am uncontrollably strong, or you'll have to think of introducing this possibility in your budget.
customer_reviews.author: PtitSeb

customer_reviews.title: Good Racket excellent price
customer_reviews.text: After investing a fortune on high end rackets for the last 10 years, and braking most of them, I decided to look for cheaper alternatives. I tried many rackets under $100 and then I found this one. I love it, classic design, excellent power, decent control, large sweet-spot and good price. This racket is 140 grams the weight is balanced but it feels a little heavy and the grip is a little thick. If you prefer light head rackets this one probably is not for you. For some reason I feel very comfortable playing with this racket. Personally I cannot tell the difference from my previous favorite racket which is 3 times more expensive than this one.
customer_reviews.author: e-client

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: I have a 3.6 Squash rating. For me the racket has the right weight and balance. There is no vibration on hitting the ball. It DOES NOT break. The price is right. I had it re-strung with slightly higher tension and better strings
customer_reviews.author: Bruce J. Wong

customer_reviews.title: You can break your arm trying to break this.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third purchase of the same model. I hope they never quit producing them because they are unbreakable and at the same time have a very good performance.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best combination of cost, weight and durability
customer_reviews.text: I play squash 2-3 times per week and have purchased plenty of more expensive racquets that have ended up breaking inside of 3 months. For me, the Black Knight Bandit-2 offers the best combination of cost, weight and durability on the market today.
customer_reviews.author: Dean B

customer_reviews.title: Its not a racket, its an Elder Wand
customer_reviews.text: I have a power game so I was losing on control by using a heavy racket. This racket has the optimum weight for me and has pushed my game to the next level. Highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Aakash Deora

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the original bandit
customer_reviews.text: I brought 2 of these to replace my old bandits which had lasted for over 7 yrs, The rackets provide good power, but not as durable as the original bandit. 1 broke 2 months after purchase. Overall good value for money however. would recommend it to club level players & week-end warriors.
customer_reviews.author: Preston Parris

customer_reviews.title: Not try in a real game yet
customer_reviews.text: I will need an entire real game to have a better opinion on this product. Thank you very much for asking.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo Couto

customer_reviews.title: A light racquet!
customer_reviews.text: I am a "senior player" always looking for a light raquet, and this is one of the best racquet I have ever played with!
customer_reviews.author: Isabel de Pivaral

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Came promptly. Brand new and even came with a 3/4 cover. Plays nicely, but I'm pretty new at squash so I can give specifics.
customer_reviews.author: Miriam

customer_reviews.title: Stiff Racquet
customer_reviews.text: As is always the problem with buying racquets online, you never know what the feel will be until you hit with it. I found this racquet to be very rigid (stiff). Though reducing the string tension would help, you should expect a stiff feel when using this racquet. At present, I have wrist tendonitis, but I'm not sure whether I can blame my tendonitis on the racquet. The racquet seems fine otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Glen in Lakewood

customer_reviews.title: Really underpriced
customer_reviews.text: I like it so much I just bought my second one! Great power, nice precision, resistant and good for corners too. I've tried rackets that cost twice as much and didn't feel half as good. I've been playing with it at least twice a week for over 7 months (easily over 120 hours), still with the factory strings. Guess I'll have to replace them soon, but they've held for much longer than expected. I'm an intermediate player and have played with ~7 rackets
customer_reviews.author: Rag

customer_reviews.title: Black Knight Bandit 3 Squash Racquet is competitively priced.
customer_reviews.text: The BK Bandit 3 is a nice intermediate squash racquet & competitively priced on Amazon. The customer service from Racquet Galaxy is excellent as well.
customer_reviews.author: MaxPrimeTime

customer_reviews.title: Excellent squash Racquet
customer_reviews.text: Great product for intermediate player, nice weight, but it has very bad grip. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality squash racquet
customer_reviews.text: My husband asked me to order this for him. He is very pleased with the quality of this racquet. Our local sporting goods store does not carry squash equipment. So nice that Amazon had this to offer.
customer_reviews.author: NM Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Superb for digging out of corners
customer_reviews.text: I swapped my Dunlop which cost twice the price with my son's Bandit II, after finding the head weight perfect for back corner retrieves. This thing is unbreakable. I play everyday and have replaced the grips and strings several times due to wear. The frame is fantastic. I bought two more as backups. I'm a 3.0 player, so keep that in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Black Knight Bandit 3 Squash Racquet
product_meta.description: The most under priced racquet on the market! Light weight, moderate stiffness and maximum legal hitting surface. Larger head for more power. WEIGHT: 140 grams HEADSIZE: 500 sq.cm. FOR: Intermediate/Advanced Player RACQUET COMES FACTORY STRUNG. NO COVER INCLUDED.
feature_bullets: RACQUET COMES FACTORY STRUNG. NO COVER INCLUDED.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
